perturbation.original_text: Throughout the Term, EFS shall be solely responsible for knowledge of and compliance with all applicable international, federal, state and local laws, rules, regulations, ordinances, industry guidelines and similar restrictions (collectively, "Laws") in connection with operation of the Playboy Commerce Business. EFS shall be responsible for monitoring such Laws and taking any actions necessary to keep compliant all aspects of the Playboy Commerce Business, including, but not limited to, the Privacy Policy (as defined in Section 5.1(a)), as well as best practices relating to Direct Marketing Association ("DMA") Guidelines (as they relate to the DMA Privacy Promise, pander files, etc.).
perturbation.changed_text: Throughout the Term, EFS shall endeavor to be aware of and comply with applicable international, federal, state, and local laws, rules, regulations, ordinances, industry guidelines, and similar restrictions (collectively, "Laws") in connection with the operation of the Playboy Commerce Business. EFS will attempt to monitor such Laws and take actions it considers appropriate to maintain general compliance of the Playboy Commerce Business, including the Privacy Policy (as defined in Section 5.1(a)), as well as consider best practices relating to Direct Marketing Association ("DMA") Guidelines (as they relate to the DMA Privacy Promise, pander files, etc.).
perturbation.explanation: The modification weakens the obligation by replacing 'shall be solely responsible' with 'shall endeavor to be aware of,' making the level of responsibility unclear. 'Taking any actions necessary to keep compliant' is replaced with 'take actions it considers appropriate to maintain general compliance,' introducing subjectivity and allowing for potentially insufficient measures. This could lead to non-compliance with various consumer protection laws, data privacy regulations, or advertising standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Multiple consumer protection laws and data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA, CAN-SPAM Act) which require strict compliance and may not be satisfied by 'general compliance.'

perturbation.original_text: EFS shall prominently display, as is customary in the industry, and implement a terms of use policy ("TOU") on the Websites, which shall comply with all applicable Laws and which at a minimum prohibits orders from any customer under eighteen (18) years of age (or the applicable age of majority in the jurisdiction in which the customer resides) and explains EFS' purchasing and return policies. EFS shall implement a privacy policy ("Privacy Policy") applicable to users of the Websites and the Catalogs that is no less protective of user privacy than is required under the Laws of or otherwise applicable to the Territory. Such Privacy Policy shall be prominently displayed, as is customary in the industry, within the Websites and the Catalogs and be easily accessible to users. EFS shall not take any action, and shall not operate the Websites or the Catalogs, in contravention of such Privacy Policy or of any applicable Law, including, but not limited to, data protection provisions imposed by the United Sates, the European Union or the other countries of the Territory and other applicable Laws.
perturbation.changed_text: EFS should display a terms of use policy ("TOU") on the Websites, which should aim to comply with applicable Laws and should generally prohibit orders from customers under eighteen (18) years of age (or the applicable age of majority) and briefly explain EFS' purchasing and return policies. EFS should implement a privacy policy ("Privacy Policy") applicable to users of the Websites and the Catalogs. Such Privacy Policy should be displayed within the Websites and the Catalogs and be generally accessible to users. EFS will try not to take any action, and will attempt not to operate the Websites or the Catalogs, in contradiction of such Privacy Policy or of any applicable Law, including data protection provisions.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates specific compliance requirements. The modified text weakens these mandates. 'Shall prominently display' becomes 'should display,' 'shall comply with all applicable Laws' becomes 'should aim to comply,' and 'prohibits orders' becomes 'should generally prohibit orders.' 'Shall not take any action...in contravention of such Privacy Policy or of any applicable Law' is replaced with the much weaker, 'will try not to take any action, and will attempt not to operate...in contradiction.' This creates significant ambiguity about EFS's actual legal obligation and how strictly it must adhere to privacy and consumer protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: COPPA (Children's Online Privacy Protection Act), GDPR, CCPA, and state consumer protection laws require strict, not discretionary, compliance regarding user data, privacy policies, and age restrictions.

perturbation.original_text: EFS hereby warrants and agrees that: (a) the Merchandise designed, manufactured, advertised, promoted, sold or distributed under this Agreement shall meet the high standards of quality, workmanship, material, design, size, color and style established by Client from time to time and in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, provided that EFS can rely on the approvals granted by Client pursuant to Section 2.6; (b) EFS will not knowingly or negligently cause or authorize any or all of the Merchandise not conforming to this Agreement to be sold or distributed, as doing so may adversely affect Client's goodwill in the Playboy Marks; and (c) any such non-conforming Merchandise shall be destroyed at EFS' expense. All of the Merchandise shall conform to and comply with, in all respects, all Laws governing the design, quality, labeling and safety of such Merchandise and shall not violate the rights of any third parties.
perturbation.changed_text: EFS represents that: (a) the Merchandise designed, manufactured, advertised, promoted, sold, or distributed under this Agreement should generally meet standards of quality, workmanship, material, design, size, color, and style, provided EFS relies on approvals granted by Client; (b) EFS will try to avoid knowingly causing or authorizing Merchandise not conforming to this Agreement to be sold or distributed; and (c) EFS will consider destroying non-conforming Merchandise. The Merchandise will generally conform to Laws governing design, quality, labeling, and safety and will try not to violate the rights of third parties.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'hereby warrants and agrees that' to 'represents that' and inserting qualifiers like 'should generally meet,' 'will try to avoid,' and 'will consider,' the binding obligations become aspirational statements. Removing the strict mandate to 'destroy' non-conforming goods, and replacing 'shall conform to and comply with' to 'will generally conform to' creates ambiguity regarding product compliance and consumer safety, as the laws are there to protect consumers and require a certain standard from retailers and manufacturers.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Product Safety Act (CPSA) and state-level product liability laws mandate strict compliance with safety standards and prohibit the distribution of unsafe products, regardless of 'general' conformity or discretionary actions.
